About Me

I am a data scientist with experience in data science, and machine learning. I have experience in delivering data science projects in marketing and finance domains. Currently, I am a student at the University of San Francisco where I am completed courses such as Advanced Machine Learning, Distributed Data Systems and Relational Databases. On this website, you can learn more about my skills, experience, and interests, and get in touch with me to discuss potential opportunities or collaborations.

Projects

Instruction tuning of open source LLM using parameter efficient fine tuning

Finetuned an open-source LLM(Open Llama 3B) using Low Rank Adapter Weights using the Alpaca dataset and serving the model for inference on Ray Serve

  • HuggingFace
  • Ray
  • PEFT
  • accelerate
  • DeepSpeed

Financial Application to assist fundamental analysis of stocks using LLMs

Fin GPT 101

Given the rise of popularity of Chat GPT and LLMs, this application is to harness the power of LLMs in the domain of Finance. Think of this application as your equity research tool which you can use to ask questions about any stock. The key tools used in this project are:-
- Langchain
- Streamlit
- PineCone
- OpenAI
- OpenBB
- BeautifulSoup

Explainability of sequential recommender systems with SHAP values

As an academic collaboration with Amazon Web Services Machine Learning Solutions, I enabled SHAPLey explanations for sequential recommender systems. Generating explanations for sequential recommender systems helps identify which events are important in determining the model recommendations. The key tools used in this project are:-
- PyTorch
- SHAP
- Pandas
- Numpy
- Mlflow

Reddit and SEC filings sentiment analysis of Rusell 3000 stocks

This is a group project where we collected SEC filings(Form 10k Item 7A) on ~1600 stocks as well as reddit posts on 28 subreddits regarding investing. We then perform sentiment analysis by using a pretrained HugginFace model. The key tools used in this project are:-.
- Praw
- MongoDB
- Databricks
- PySpark
- Huggingface
- Airflow

Experience

Amazon Web Services

Machine Learning Research Intern

October 2022 - Present

As a machine learning research intern, I am currently training deep learning based sequential recommender systems on open source datasets and using SHAP to drive explainability.(Research paper in draft phase)

  • Train sequential deep learning recommender models on 3 open-source datasets (ML-1m/Yelp/Amazon Books).
  • Model explainability of recommender system models using KERNELSHAP and extending it to the sequential domain.

Hypersonix Inc

Senior Data Scientist

April 2020 - June 2022

Hypersonix

As a senior data scientist, I have executed multiple data science projects in the areas of promotion, pricing & supply chain for customers with annual revenues of > $100M.

  • Developed and implemented a text similarity model utilizing FuzzyWuzzy and Spacy to accurately map customers across three separate Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems with 70% accuracy replacing the manual approach.
  • Designed ETL pipelines for monitoring order statuses and tracking truck movements from distribution centers to stores. Developed a uniform schema across 12 tables, which resulted in 86% of orders being mapped to exact delivery times.
  • Designed a promotion effectiveness model that calculated key drivers of promotion, such as direct lift, halo and cannibalization at the item level. Escalated ~ 5% of promotions on a weekly basis.
  • Calculated optimal inventory levels and replenishment schedules for all SKUs by time series forecasting (FB-Prophet) and Linear Programming techniques (MIP on CPLEX) for better supply chain management.

Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst

July 2018 - April 2020

Jumbo Group

As part of the FP&A team, I was responsible for budgeting,forecasting and presentation of financial statements to the executive leadership.

  • Optimized key monthly task processes by writing a VBA Macro reducing book closure time by 20%.
  • Designed, reported and maintained financial models on working capital, inventory and debtor aging.

HSBC

Summer Intern

April 2017 - June 2017

HSBC

As part of the Corporate Banking Team, I conducted a market research study to identify opportunities for business development and worked on the consolidation of loans for a key client.

  • Developed a list of 72 prospective clients by conducting a market study on French and Swedish subsidiaries in India.
  • Examined the loan book of the client to identify opportunities for consolidation & proposed a solution to consolidate a $20M outstanding loan across 55 entities by 400%.
